snippet.textDisplay: Loosing weight can generally help with some joint and muscle soreness.  Not all of it if you really have an issue/disease ......but seems like it could help in her case.
snippet.textOriginal: Loosing weight can generally help with some joint and muscle soreness.  Not all of it if you really have an issue/disease ......but seems like it could help in her case.

snippet.textDisplay: As an actual sufferer of EDS, I can say with certainty that this woman is SO full of bull. Before physical therapy, my hips especially would dislocate frequently, my spine curved severely and I still kept a job at a call center. Now that I  able to manage my symptoms and use compression ware, I am ab esthetician and am able to do light exercises to keep healthy. The pain is still an issue at times, but depending on the classification or subtype of EDS, it is easily conceivable to live a fairly normal life. If this woman was as bad as she says she is with EDS, she would be in a wheelchair and more than likely in a special care home. People will do anything to just get out of life, when the ones who are sick will actually put forth the effort to live life

snippet.textDisplay: i had scoliosis and got surgery for it. after surgery, i gained weight; my body was completely different. the weight added to the pain; i have lost about 30-40 lbs now and i feel so much lighter and less painful. the weight adds to it :/

snippet.textDisplay: As someone with eds, this lady is giving us a bad name. This is coming from someone with aggressive arthritis in both knees and constant dislocations and subluxations. This seriously makes me mad, I work full time and I try to pop everything back in myself when it happens, especially my hip and I'm only 23.
snippet.textOriginal: As someone with eds, this lady is giving us a bad name. This is coming from someone with aggressive arthritis in both knees and constant dislocations and subluxations. snippet.textDisplay: BS!  Stop feeling sorry for yourself....life is hard for everyone but if you just give up eventually you'll  become bed ridden and an even more tremendous burden on everyone around you. NOT FAIR!    Excercise and healthy diet can eliminate many ailments...if you are sedentary of course you become depressed, become obese, muscles and joints hurt and start to deteriorate, and your mental health is greatly affected as well as every organ in your body.  If you have an actual ailment, as many of us do, you need to be diagnosed and treated but no matter what you have you still need to do the basics... eat healthy, excersize daily which will uplift you mentally.  We all have issues that only we ourselves can fix, it's definitely not your daughter's responsibility.  I wish this family the best.  This woman isn't that old and could have another 30 really happy years if she will just try.
